newsitem.title: USA: NBC tops U.S TV ratings week, FOX nabs third.
newsitem.headline: NBC tops U.S TV ratings week, FOX nabs third.

text.p: General Electric Co Unit NBC took the top ratings spot attracting evening-hours audiences in the week ended October 20, bolstered by its strong Thursday programming lineup, Neilsen Media Research said on Tuesday.

According to Neilsen, the ABC network, owned by Walt Disney Co, took second place and News Corp Ltd's FOX network, rose to third, boosted by Major League Baseball's playoffs and the first game of the World Series.
CBS Inc, owned by Westinghouse Electric Co, tumbled to fourth place in the number of homes tuned into its evening hours programs, after claiming the top spot last week.
For the week which ended Sunday:
-- NBC drew an average 10.5 rating, or percentage of America's 97 million homes with televisions, and an 18 percent share of homes watching television during those hours;
-- ABC had a rating of 9.7 on average, and a 16 percent share of homes watching television;
-- FOX's average rating jumped to 9.6 from 6.2 last week, and grabbed a 16 percent share of audiences.
-- CBS earned a 9.4 rating. Its share was also 16.
-- UPN, a unit of Chris-Craft Industries allied with Viacom Inc, had a rating of 3.1 and a share of five percent;
-- WB, a unit of Time Warner Inc, also had a 3.1 rating and a five percent share.
